meanings.definition: A cutting tool with a curved blade for trimming branches or cutting brush.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a billhook to prune the overgrown bushes in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I saw the gardener carrying a billhook to trim the tree branches.
meanings.sent3: The billhook and the bushes had a little dance as the farmer worked on the garden.
meanings.sent4: The billhook sliced through the branches like a sharp knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The shiny billhook gleamed in the sunlight as it made quick work of the thick branches.

meanings.definition: To cut or trim with a billhook.
meanings.sent1: She will billhook the overgrown hedges in the backyard tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to billhook the excess growth to tidy up the field.
meanings.sent3: The billhooked bushes looked like they just got a fancy haircut.
meanings.sent4: His words billhooked through the silence, leaving a lasting impact on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The chef billhooked the vegetables with precision, showcasing his knife skills.
